member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode
member.summary: This interface represents a node which is able to provide real-time frequency and time-domain analysis information. The audio stream will be passed un-processed from input to output.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode.GetFloatFrequencyData(System.Collections.TypedArrays.Float32Array)
member.summary: Copies the current frequency data into the passed floating-point array. If the array has fewer elements than the frequencyBinCount, the excess elements will be dropped.
member.param: The array parameter is where frequency-domain analysis data will be copied.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode.GetByteFrequencyData(System.Collections.TypedArrays.Uint8Array)
member.summary: Copies the current frequency data into the passed unsigned byte array. If the array has fewer elements than the frequencyBinCount, the excess elements will be dropped.
member.param: The array parameter is where frequency-domain analysis data will be copied.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode.GetByteTimeDomainData(System.Collections.TypedArrays.Uint8Array)
member.summary: Copies the current time-domain (waveform) data into the passed unsigned byte array. If the array has fewer elements than the frequencyBinCount, the excess elements will be dropped.
member.param: The array parameter is where time-domain analysis data will be copied.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode.FftSize
member.summary: The size of the FFT used for frequency-domain analysis. This must be a power of two.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode.FrequencyBinCount
member.summary: Half the FFT size.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode.MinDecibels
member.summary: The minimum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data for conversion to unsigned byte values.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode.MaxDecibels
member.summary: The maximum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data for conversion to unsigned byte values.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AnalyserNode.SmoothingTimeConstant
member.summary: A value from 0 -> 1 where 0 represents no time averaging with the last analysis frame.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBuffer
member.summary: This interface represents a memory-resident audio asset (for one-shot sounds and other short audio clips). Its format is non-interleaved IEEE 32-bit linear PCM with a nominal range of -1 -> +1. It can contain one or more channels.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBuffer.SampleRate
member.summary: The sample-rate for the PCM audio data in samples per second.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBuffer.Length
member.summary: Length of the PCM audio data in sample-frames.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBuffer.Duration
member.summary: Duration of the PCM audio data in seconds.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBuffer.NumberOfChannels
member.summary: The number of discrete audio channels.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBuffer.GetChannelData(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns the Float32Array representing the PCM audio data for the specific channel.
member.param: The channel parameter is an index representing the particular channel to get data for. An index value of 0 represents the first channel. This index value MUST be less than numberOfChannels or an exception will be thrown.
member.returns: The Float32Array filled with the PCM audio data for the requested channel.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode
member.summary: This interface represents an audio source from an in-memory audio asset in an AudioBuffer.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.PlaybackState
member.summary: The playback state, initialized to AudioBufferSourceNodePlaybackState.UnscheduledState.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.Buffer
member.summary: Represents the audio asset to be played.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.PlaybackRate
member.summary: The speed at which to render the audio stream. The default playbackRate.value is 1. This parameter is a-rate.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.Loop
member.summary: Indicates if the audio data should play in a loop. The default value is false.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.LoopStart
member.summary: An optional value in seconds where looping should begin if the loop attribute is true. Its default value is 0, and it may usefully be set to any value between 0 and the duration of the buffer.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.LoopEnd
member.summary: An optional value in seconds where looping should end if the loop attribute is true. Its default value is 0, and it may usefully be set to any value between 0 and the duration of the buffer.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.Start(System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules a sound to playback at an exact time.
member.param: The when parameter describes at what time (in seconds) the sound should start playing. It is in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. If 0 is passed in for this value or if the value is less than currentTime, then the sound will start playing immediately. start may only be called one time and must be called before stop is called or an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.Start(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules a sound to playback at an exact time.
member.param: The when parameter describes at what time (in seconds) the sound should start playing. It is in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. If 0 is passed in for this value or if the value is less than currentTime, then the sound will start playing immediately. start may only be called one time and must be called before stop is called or an exception will be thrown.
The offset parameter describes the offset time in the buffer (in seconds) where playback will begin.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.Start(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules a sound to playback at an exact time.
member.param: The when parameter describes at what time (in seconds) the sound should start playing. It is in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. If 0 is passed in for this value or if the value is less than currentTime, then the sound will start playing immediately. start may only be called one time and must be called before stop is called or an exception will be thrown.
The offset parameter describes the offset time in the buffer (in seconds) where playback will begin.
The duration parameter describes the duration of the portion (in seconds) to be played.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBufferSourceNode.Stop(System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules a sound to stop playback at an exact time.
member.param: The when parameter describes at what time (in seconds) the sound should stop playing. It is in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. If 0 is passed in for this value or if the value is less than currentTime, then the sound will stop playing immediately. stop must only be called one time and only after a call to start or stop, or an exception will be thrown.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext
member.summary: This interface represents a set of AudioNode objects and their connections. It allows for arbitrary routing of signals to the AudioDestinationNode (what the user ultimately hears). Nodes are created from the context and are then connected together. In most use cases, only a single AudioContext is used per document.
member.remarks: Once created, an AudioContext will not be garbage collected. It will live until the document goes away.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new AudioContext.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.Destination
member.summary: An AudioDestinationNode with a single input representing the final destination for all audio (to be rendered to the audio hardware). All AudioNodes actively rendering audio will directly or indirectly connect to destination.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.SampleRate
member.summary: The sample rate (in sample-frames per second) at which the AudioContext handles audio. It is assumed that all AudioNodes in the context run at this rate. In making this assumption, sample-rate converters or "varispeed" processors are not supported in real-time processing.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CurrentTime
member.summary: This is a time in seconds which starts at zero when the context is created and increases in real-time. All scheduled times are relative to it. This is not a "transport" time which can be started, paused, and re-positioned. It is always moving forward. A GarageBand-like timeline transport system can be very easily built on top of this (in JavaScript). This time corresponds to an ever-increasing hardware timestamp.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.Listener
member.summary: An AudioListener which is used for 3D spatialization.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.ActiveSourceCount
member.summary: The number of AudioBufferSourceNodes that are currently playing.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateBuffer(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates an AudioBuffer of the given size. The audio data in the buffer will be zero-initialized (silent). An exception will be thrown if the numberOfChannels or sampleRate are out-of-bounds.
member.param: The numberOfChannels parameter determines how many channels the buffer will have. An implementation must support at least 32 channels.
The length parameter determines the size of the buffer in sample-frames.

The sampleRate parameter describes the sample-rate of the linear PCM audio data in the buffer in sample-frames per second. An implementation must support sample-rates in at least the range 22050 to 96000.
member.returns: Returns the newly created AudioBuffer object.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateBuffer(System.Collections.TypedArrays.ArrayBuffer,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an AudioBuffer given the audio file data contained in the ArrayBuffer. The ArrayBuffer can, for example, be loaded from an XMLHttpRequest's response attribute after setting the responseType to "arraybuffer". Audio file data can be in any of the formats supported by the audio element.
member.param: The buffer parameter contains the audio file data (for example from a .wav file).
The mixToMono parameter determines if a mixdown to mono will be performed. Normally, this would not be set.
member.returns: Returns the newly created AudioBuffer object.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.DecodeAudioData(System.Collections.TypedArrays.ArrayBuffer,System.Action{System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBuffer})
member.summary: Asynchronously decodes the audio file data contained in the ArrayBuffer. The ArrayBuffer can, for example, be loaded from an XMLHttpRequest's response attribute after setting the responseType to "arraybuffer". Audio file data can be in any of the formats supported by the audio element.
member.param: audioData is an ArrayBuffer containing audio file data.
successCallback is a callback function which will be invoked when the decoding is finished. The single argument to this callback is an AudioBuffer representing the decoded PCM audio data.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.DecodeAudioData(System.Collections.TypedArrays.ArrayBuffer,System.Action{System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioBuffer},System.Action)
member.summary: Asynchronously decodes the audio file data contained in the ArrayBuffer. The ArrayBuffer can, for example, be loaded from an XMLHttpRequest's response attribute after setting the responseType to "arraybuffer". Audio file data can be in any of the formats supported by the audio element.
member.param: audioData is an ArrayBuffer containing audio file data.
successCallback is a callback function which will be invoked when the decoding is finished. The single argument to this callback is an AudioBuffer representing the decoded PCM audio data.
errorCallback is a callback function which will be invoked if there is an error decoding the audio file data.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateBufferSource
member.summary: Creates an AudioBufferSourceNode.

member.summary: Creates a MediaElementAudioSourceNode given an HTMLMediaElement. As a consequence of calling this method, audio playback from the HTMLMediaElement will be re-routed into the processing graph of the AudioContext.
member.param: mediaElement is an HTMLMediaElement (e.g. audio or video) whose audio playback should be rerouted into the AudioContext

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateMediaStreamSource(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a MediaStreamAudioSourceNode given a MediaStream. As a consequence of calling this method, audio playback from the MediaStream will be re-routed into the processing graph of the AudioContext.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateScriptProcessor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a ScriptProcessorNode for direct audio processing using JavaScript. An exception will be thrown if bufferSize or numberOfInputChannels or numberOfOutputChannels are outside the valid range.
member.param: The bufferSize parameter determines the buffer size in units of sample-frames. It must be one of the following values: 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384. This value controls how frequently the onaudioprocess event handler is called and how many sample-frames need to be processed each call. Lower values for bufferSize will result in a lower (better) latency. Higher values will be necessary to avoid audio breakup and glitches. The value chosen must carefully balance between latency and audio quality.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateScriptProcessor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a ScriptProcessorNode for direct audio processing using JavaScript. An exception will be thrown if bufferSize or numberOfInputChannels or numberOfOutputChannels are outside the valid range.
member.param: The bufferSize parameter determines the buffer size in units of sample-frames. It must be one of the following values: 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384. This value controls how frequently the onaudioprocess event handler is called and how many sample-frames need to be processed each call. Lower values for bufferSize will result in a lower (better) latency. Higher values will be necessary to avoid audio breakup and glitches. The value chosen must carefully balance between latency and audio quality.
The numberOfInputChannels parameter (defaults to 2) and determines the number of channels for this node's input. Values of up to 32 must be supported.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateScriptProcessor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a ScriptProcessorNode for direct audio processing using JavaScript. An exception will be thrown if bufferSize or numberOfInputChannels or numberOfOutputChannels are outside the valid range.
member.param: The bufferSize parameter determines the buffer size in units of sample-frames. It must be one of the following values: 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384. This value controls how frequently the onaudioprocess event handler is called and how many sample-frames need to be processed each call. Lower values for bufferSize will result in a lower (better) latency. Higher values will be necessary to avoid audio breakup and glitches. The value chosen must carefully balance between latency and audio quality.
The numberOfInputChannels parameter (defaults to 2) and determines the number of channels for this node's input. Values of up to 32 must be supported.
The numberOfOutputChannels parameter (defaults to 2) and determines the number of channels for this node's output. Values of up to 32 must be supported.

member.summary: Creates a AnalyserNode.

member.summary: Creates a DynamicsCompressorNode.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateOscillator
member.summary: Creates an OscillatorNode.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioContext.CreateWaveTable(System.Collections.TypedArrays.Float32Array,System.Collections.TypedArrays.Float32Array)
member.summary: Creates a WaveTable representing a waveform containing arbitrary harmonic content. The real and imag parameters specify the Fourier coefficients of a Fourier series representing the partials of a periodic waveform. The created WaveTable will be used with an OscillatorNode and will represent a normalized time-domain waveform having maximum absolute peak value of 1. Another way of saying this is that the generated waveform of an OscillatorNode will have maximum peak value at 0dBFS. Conveniently, this corresponds to the full-range of the signal values used by the Web Audio API. Because the WaveTable will be normalized on creation, the real and imag parameters represent relative values.
member.param: The real parameter represents an array of cosine terms (traditionally the A terms). In audio terminology, the first element (index 0) is the DC-offset of the periodic waveform and is usually set to zero. The second element (index 1) represents the fundamental frequency. The third element represents the first overtone, and so on. The supplied Float32Array must have a length greater than zero and less than or equal to 4096 or an exception will be thrown.

The imag parameter represents an array of sine terms (traditionally the B terms). The first element (index 0) should be set to zero (and will be ignored) since this term does not exist in the Fourier series. The second element (index 1) represents the fundamental frequency. The third element represents the first overtone, and so on. The supplied Float32Array must have a length greater than zero and less than or equal to 4096 or an exception will be thrown.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioDestinationNode
member.summary: AudioDestinationNode is an AudioNode representing the final audio destination and is what the user will ultimately hear. It can be considered as an audio output device which is connected to speakers. All rendered audio to be heard will be routed to this node, a "terminal" node in the AudioContext's routing graph. There is only a single AudioDestinationNode per AudioContext, provided through the destination attribute of AudioContext.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioDestinationNode.MaxNumberOfChannels
member.summary: The maximum number of channels that the numberOfChannels attribute can be set to. An AudioDestinationNode representing the audio hardware end-point (the normal case) can potentially output more than 2 channels of audio if the audio hardware is multi-channel. maxNumberOfChannels is the maximum number of channels that this hardware is capable of supporting. If this value is 0, then this indicates that maxNumberOfChannels may not be changed. This will be the case for an AudioDestinationNode in an OfflineAudioContext.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioDestinationNode.NumberOfChannels
member.summary: The number of channels of the destination's input. This value will default to 2, and may be set to any non-zero value less than or equal to maxNumberOfChannels. An exception will be thrown if this value is not within the valid range. Giving a concrete example, if the audio hardware supports 8-channel output, then we may set numberOfChannels to 8, and render 8-channels of output.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioListener
member.summary: This interface represents the position and orientation of the person listening to the audio scene. All PannerNode objects spatialize in relation to the AudioContext's listener.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioListener.DopplerFactor
member.summary: A constant used to determine the amount of pitch shift to use when rendering a doppler effect. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioListener.SpeedOfSound
member.summary: The speed of sound used for calculating doppler shift. The default value is 343.3 meters / second.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioListener.SetPosition(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the position of the listener in a 3D cartesian coordinate space. PannerNode objects use this position relative to individual audio sources for spatialization.
member.param: The x parameter represents the X coordinate in 3D space.
The y parameter represents the Y coordinate in 3D space.
The z parameter represents the Z coordinate in 3D space.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioListener.SetOrientation(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Describes which direction the listener is pointing in the 3D cartesian coordinate space. Both a front vector and an up vector are provided. In simple human terms, the front vector represents which direction the person's nose is pointing. The up vector represents the direction the top of a person's head is pointing. These values are expected to be linearly independent (at right angles to each other).
member.param: The x parameter represents the X component of a front direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being 0.
The y parameter represents the Y component of a front direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being 0.
The z parameter represents the Z component of a front direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being -1.
The xUp parameter represents the X component of an up direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being 0.
The yUp parameter represents the Y component of an up direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being 1.
The zUp parameter represents the Z component of an up direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being 0.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioListener.SetVelocity(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the velocity vector of the listener. This vector controls both the direction of travel and the speed in 3D space. This velocity relative to an audio source's velocity is used to determine how much doppler shift (pitch change) to apply. The units used for this vector is meters / second and is independent of the units used for position and orientation vectors.
member.param: The x parameter describe the X component of a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity.
The y parameter describe the Y component of a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity.
The z parameter describe the Z component of a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity.

The output parameter is an index describing which output of the AudioNode from which to connect. An out-of-bound value throws an exception.
The input parameter is an index describing which input of the destination AudioNode to connect to. An out-of-bound value throws an exception.

member.summary: The AudioContext which owns this AudioNode.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioNode.NumberOfInputs
member.summary: The number of inputs feeding into the AudioNode. This will be 0 for an AudioSourceNode.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioNode.NumberOfOutputs
member.summary: The number of outputs coming out of the AudioNode. This will be 0 for an AudioDestinationNode.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam
member.summary: AudioParam controls an individual aspect of an AudioNode's functioning (e.g., volume).

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.Value
member.summary: The parameter's floating-point value. This attribute is initialized to the defaultValue. If a value is set outside the allowable range described by minValue and maxValue no exception is thrown, because these limits are just nominal and may be exceeded. If a value is set during a time when there are any automation events scheduled then it will be ignored and no exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.ComputedValue
member.summary: The final value controlling the audio DSP.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.MinValue
member.summary: Nominal minimum value. This attribute is informational and value may be set lower than this value.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.MaxValue
member.summary: Nominal maximum value. This attribute is informational and value may be set higher than this value.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.DefaultValue
member.summary: Initial value for the value attribute.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.SetValueAtTime(System.Single,System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules a parameter value change at the given time.
member.param: The value parameter is the value the parameter will change to at the given time.
The startTime parameter is the time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.LinearRampToValueAtTime(System.Single,System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules a linear continuous change in parameter value from the previous scheduled parameter value to the given value.
member.param: The value parameter is the value the parameter will linearly ramp to at the given time.
The endTime parameter is the time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.ExponentialRampToValueAtTime(System.Single,System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules an exponential continuous change in parameter value from the previous scheduled parameter value to the given value. Parameters representing filter frequencies and playback rate are best changed exponentially because of the way humans perceive sound.
member.param: The value parameter is the value the parameter will exponentially ramp to at the given time. An exception will be thrown if this value is less than or equal to 0, or if the value at the time of the previous event is less than or equal to 0.
The endTime parameter is the time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.SetTargetAtTime(System.Single,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Start exponentially approaching the target value at the given time with a rate having the given time constant. Among other uses, this is useful for implementing the "decay" and "release" portions of an ADSR envelope. Please note that the parameter value does not immediately change to the target value at the given time, but instead gradually changes to the target value.
member.param: The target parameter is the value the parameter will start changing to at the given time.
The startTime parameter is the time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.
The timeConstant parameter is the time-constant value of first-order filter (exponential) approach to the target value. The larger this value is, the slower the transition will be.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.SetValueCurveAtTime(System.Collections.TypedArrays.Float32Array,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets an array of arbitrary parameter values starting at the given time for the given duration. The number of values will be scaled to fit into the desired duration.
member.param: The values parameter is a Float32Array representing a parameter value curve. These values will apply starting at the given time and lasting for the given duration.
The startTime parameter is the time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime
The duration parameter is the amount of time in seconds (after the time parameter) where values will be calculated according to the values parameter.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioParam.CancelScheduledValues(System.Double)
member.summary: Cancels all scheduled parameter changes with times greater than or equal to startTime.
member.param: The startTime parameter is the starting time at and after which any previously scheduled parameter changes will be cancelled. It is a time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioProcessingEvent
member.summary: This interface is a type of Event which is passed to the onaudioprocess event handler used by ScriptProcessorNode.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioProcessingEvent.Node
member.summary: The ScriptProcessorNode associated with this processing event.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioProcessingEvent.PlaybackTime
member.summary: The time when the audio will be played in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. playbackTime allows for very tight synchronization between processing directly in script with the other events in the context's rendering graph.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioProcessingEvent.InputBuffer
member.summary: An AudioBuffer containing the input audio data. It will have a number of channels equal to the numberOfInputChannels parameter of the createScriptProcessor() method. This AudioBuffer is only valid while in the scope of the onaudioprocess function. Its values will be meaningless outside of this scope.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioProcessingEvent.OutputBuffer
member.summary: An AudioBuffer where the output audio data should be written. It will have a number of channels equal to the numberOfOutputChannels parameter of the createScriptProcessor() method. Script code within the scope of the onaudioprocess function is expected to modify the Float32Array arrays representing channel data in this AudioBuffer. Any script modifications to this AudioBuffer outside of this scope will not produce any audible effects.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.AudioSourceNode
member.summary: This is an abstract interface representing an audio source, an AudioNode which has no inputs and a single output:

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.BiquadFilterNode
member.summary: BiquadFilterNode is an AudioNode processor implementing very common low-order filters.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.BiquadFilterNode.Type
member.summary: The filter type to be implemented by this node.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.BiquadFilterNode.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency setting for the selected filter type, in hertz.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.BiquadFilterNode.Detune
member.summary: The detune setting for the selected filter type, in cents.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.BiquadFilterNode.Q
member.summary: The Q setting for the selected filter type.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.BiquadFilterNode.Gain
member.summary: The gain setting for the selected filter type, in decibels.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.BiquadFilterNode.GetFrequencyResponse(System.Collections.TypedArrays.Float32Array,System.Collections.TypedArrays.Float32Array,System.Collections.TypedArrays.Float32Array)
member.summary: Given the current filter parameter settings, calculates the frequency response for the specified frequencies.
member.param: The frequencyHz parameter specifies an array of frequencies at which the response values will be calculated.
The magResponse parameter specifies an output array receiving the linear magnitude response values.
The phaseResponse parameter specifies an output array receiving the phase response values in radians.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.ChannelMergerNode
member.summary: This interface represents an AudioNode for combining channels from multiple audio streams into a single audio stream.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.ChannelSplitterNode
member.summary: This interface represents an AudioNode for accessing the individual channels of an audio stream in the routing graph.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.ConvolverNode
member.summary: This interface represents a processing node which applies a linear convolution effect given an impulse response.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.ConvolverNode.Buffer
member.summary: A mono, stereo, or 4-channel AudioBuffer containing the (possibly multi-channel) impulse response used by the ConvolverNode. At the time when this attribute is set, the buffer and the state of the normalize attribute will be used to configure the ConvolverNode with this impulse response having the given normalization.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.ConvolverNode.Normalize
member.summary: Controls whether the impulse response from the buffer will be scaled by an equal-power normalization when the buffer atttribute is set. Its default value is true in order to achieve a more uniform output level from the convolver when loaded with diverse impulse responses. If normalize is set to false, then the convolution will be rendered with no pre-processing/scaling of the impulse response. Changes to this value do not take effect until the next time the buffer attribute is set.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.DelayNode
member.summary: This interface is an AudioNode with a single input and single output which delays the incoming audio signal by a certain amount.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.DelayNode.DelayTime
member.summary: An AudioParam object representing the amount of delay (in seconds) to apply. The default value (delayTime.value) is 0 (no delay). The minimum value is 0 and the maximum value is determined by the maxDelayTime argument to the AudioContext method createDelay. This parameter is k-rate.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.DynamicsCompressorNode
member.summary: DynamicsCompressorNode is an AudioNode processor implementing a dynamics compression effect.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.DynamicsCompressorNode.Threshold
member.summary: The decibel value above which the compression will start taking effect. Its default value is -24, with a nominal range of -100 to 0. This parameter is k-rate.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.DynamicsCompressorNode.Knee
member.summary: A decibel value representing the range above the threshold where the curve smoothly transitions to the "ratio" portion. Its default value is 30, with a nominal range of 0 to 40. This parameter is k-rate.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.DynamicsCompressorNode.Ratio
member.summary: The amount of dB change in input for a 1 dB change in output. Its default value is 12, with a nominal range of 1 to 20. This parameter is k-rate.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.DynamicsCompressorNode.Reduction
member.summary: A read-only decibel value for metering purposes, representing the current amount of gain reduction that the compressor is applying to the signal. If fed no signal the value will be 0 (no gain reduction). The nominal range is -20 to 0. This parameter is k-rate.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.DynamicsCompressorNode.Attack
member.summary: The amount of time (in seconds) to reduce the gain by 10dB. Its default value is 0.003, with a nominal range of 0 to 1. This parameter is k-rate.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.DynamicsCompressorNode.Release
member.summary: The amount of time (in seconds) to increase the gain by 10dB. Its default value is 0.250, with a nominal range of 0 to 1. This parameter is k-rate.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.GainNode
member.summary: This interface is an AudioNode with a single input and single output which multiplies the input audio signal by the (possibly time-varying) gain attribute, copying the result to the output.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.GainNode.Gain
member.summary: Represents the amount of gain to apply. Its default value is 1 (no gain change). The nominal minValue is 0, but may be set negative for phase inversion. The nominal maxValue is 1, but higher values are allowed (no exception thrown). This parameter is a-rate.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.MediaElementAudioSourceNode
member.summary: MediaElementAudioSourceNode represents an audio source from an audio or video element.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.MediaStreamAudioSourceNode
member.summary: This interface represents an audio source from a MediaStream. The first AudioMediaStreamTrack from the MediaStream will be used as a source of audio.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.OfflineAudioContext
member.summary: OfflineAudioContext is a particular type of AudioContext for rendering/mixing-down (potentially) faster than real-time. It does not render to the audio hardware, but instead renders as quickly as possible, calling a render callback function upon completion with the result provided as an AudioBuffer.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.OfflineAudioContext.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new OfflineAudioContext renderer.
member.param: The numberOfChannels parameter specifies the target number of channels to render to.
The length parameter specifies the number of samples to render.
The sampleRate parameter specifies the sample rate to render with.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.OfflineAudioContext.StartRendering
member.summary: Renders the AudioNodes connected to this context. The OnComplete callback will be called when the rendering has completed.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.OfflineAudioContext.OnComplete
member.summary: The callback to call when the rendering operation has completed.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.OscillatorNode
member.summary: OscillatorNode represents an audio source generating a periodic waveform.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.OscillatorNode.Type
member.summary: The shape of the periodic waveform. It may directly be set to any of the enumeration values except for OscillatorType.Custom. The SetWaveTable() method can be used to set a custom waveform, which results in this attribute being set to OscillatorType.Custom. The default value is OscillatorType.Sine.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.OscillatorNode.PlaybackState
member.summary: defined as in AudioBufferSourceNode.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.OscillatorNode.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency (in Hertz) of the periodic waveform. This parameter is a-rate.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.OscillatorNode.Detune
member.summary: A detuning value (in Cents) which will offset the frequency by the given amount. This parameter is a-rate.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.OscillatorNode.Start(System.Double)
member.summary: defined as in AudioBufferSourceNode.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.OscillatorNode.Stop(System.Double)
member.summary: defined as in AudioBufferSourceNode.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.OscillatorNode.SetWaveTable(System.Html.Media.Audio.WaveTable)
member.summary: Sets an arbitrary custom periodic waveform given a WaveTable.
member.param: The waveTable parameter specifies the wave table to use to specify a custom waveform.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode
member.summary: This interface represents a processing node which positions / spatializes an incoming audio stream in three-dimensional space. The spatialization is in relation to the AudioContext's AudioListener (listener attribute).

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.PanningModel
member.summary: Determines which spatialization algorithm will be used to position the audio in 3D space. The default is PanningModelType.HRTF.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.SetPosition(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the position of the audio source relative to the listener attribute. A 3D cartesian coordinate system is used.
member.param: The x parameter represents the X coordinate in 3D space.
The y parameter represents the Y coordinate in 3D space.
The z parameter represents the Z coordinate in 3D space.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.SetOrientation(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Describes which direction the audio source is pointing in the 3D cartesian coordinate space. Depending on how directional the sound is (controlled by the cone attributes), a sound pointing away from the listener can be very quiet or completely silent.
member.param: The x parameter represents the X component of a direction vector in 3D space.
The y parameter represents the Y component of a direction vector in 3D space.
The z parameter represents the Z component of a direction vector in 3D space.

member.name: M:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.SetVelocity(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the velocity vector of the audio source. This vector controls both the direction of travel and the speed in 3D space. This velocity relative to the listener's velocity is used to determine how much doppler shift (pitch change) to apply. The units used for this vector is meters / second and is independent of the units used for position and orientation vectors.
member.param: The x parameter describes the X component of a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity.
The y parameter describes the Y component of a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity.
The z parameter describes the Z component of a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.DistanceModel
member.summary: Determines which algorithm will be used to reduce the volume of an audio source as it moves away from the listener. The default is DistanceModelType.Inverse.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.RefDistance
member.summary: A reference distance for reducing volume as source move further from the listener. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.MaxDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance between source and listener, after which the volume will not be reduced any further. The default value is 10000.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.RolloffFactor
member.summary: Describes how quickly the volume is reduced as source moves away from listener. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.ConeInnerAngle
member.summary: A parameter for directional audio sources, this is an angle, inside of which there will be no volume reduction. The default value is 360.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.ConeOuterAngle
member.summary: A parameter for directional audio sources, this is an angle, outside of which the volume will be reduced to a constant value of coneOuterGain. The default value is 360.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.PannerNode.ConeOuterGain
member.summary: A parameter for directional audio sources, this is the amount of volume reduction outside of the coneOuterAngle. The default value is 0.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.ScriptProcessorNode
member.summary: This interface is an AudioNode which can generate, process, or analyse audio directly using a supplied callback.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.ScriptProcessorNode.OnAudioProcess
member.summary: An event listener which is called periodically for audio processing. An event of type AudioProcessingEvent will be passed to the event handler.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.ScriptProcessorNode.BufferSize
member.summary: The size of the buffer (in sample-frames) which needs to be processed each time onprocessaudio is called. Legal values are (256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384).

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.WaveShaperNode
member.summary: WaveShaperNode is an AudioNode processor implementing non-linear distortion effects.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Audio.WaveShaperNode.Curve
member.summary: The shaping curve used for the waveshaping effect. The input signal is nominally within the range -1 -> +1. Each input sample within this range will index into the shaping curve with a signal level of zero corresponding to the center value of the curve array. Any sample value less than -1 will correspond to the first value in the curve array. Any sample value less greater than +1 will correspond to the last value in the curve array.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Audio.WaveTable
member.summary: WaveTable represents an arbitrary periodic waveform to be used with an OscillatorNode.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLActiveInfo
member.summary: The WebGLActiveInfo interface represents the information returned from the getActiveAttrib and getActiveUniform calls.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLActiveInfo.Size
member.summary: The size of the requested variable.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLActiveInfo.Type
member.summary: The data type of the requested variable.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLActiveInfo.Name
member.summary: The name of the requested variable.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLBuffer
member.summary: The WebGLBuffer interface represents an OpenGL Buffer Object. The underlying object is created as if by calling glGenBuffers, bound as if by calling glBindBuffer and destroyed as if by calling glDeleteBuffers.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes
member.summary: The WebGLContextAttributes dictionary contains drawing surface attributes and is passed as the second parameter to getContext.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.Alpha
member.summary: If the value is true, the drawing buffer has an alpha channel for the purposes of performing OpenGL destination alpha operations and compositing with the page. If the value is false, no alpha buffer is available.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.Depth
member.summary: If the value is true, the drawing buffer has a depth buffer of at least 16 bits. If the value is false, no depth buffer is available.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.Stencil
member.summary: If the value is true, the drawing buffer has a stencil buffer of at least 8 bits. If the value is false, no stencil buffer is available.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.Antialias
member.summary: If the value is true and the implementation supports antialiasing the drawing buffer will perform antialiasing using its choice of technique (multisample/supersample) and quality. If the value is false or the implementation does not support antialiasing, no antialiasing is performed.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.PremultipliedAlpha
member.summary: If the value is true the page compositor will assume the drawing buffer contains colors with premultiplied alpha. If the value is false the page compositor will assume that colors in the drawing buffer are not premultiplied. This flag is ignored if the alpha flag is false.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.PreserveDrawingBuffer
member.summary: If false, once the drawing buffer is presented, the contents of the drawing buffer are cleared to their default values. All elements of the drawing buffer (color, depth and stencil) are cleared. If the value is true the buffers will not be cleared and will preserve their values until cleared or overwritten by the author.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLFramebuffer
member.summary: The WebGLFramebuffer interface represents an OpenGL Framebuffer Object. The underlying object is created as if by calling glGenFramebuffers, bound as if by calling glBindFramebuffer and destroyed as if by calling glDeleteFramebuffers.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLObject
member.summary: The WebGLObject interface is the parent interface for all GL objects.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLProgram
member.summary: The WebGLProgram interface represents an OpenGL Program Object. The underlying object is created as if by calling glCreateProgram, used as if by calling glUseProgram and destroyed as if by calling glDeleteProgram.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLRenderbuffer
member.summary: The WebGLRenderbuffer interface represents an OpenGL Renderbuffer Object. The underlying object is created as if by calling glGenRenderbuffers, bound as if by calling glBindRenderbuffer and destroyed as if by calling glDeleteRenderbuffers.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLShader
member.summary: The WebGLShader interface represents an OpenGL Shader Object. The underlying object is created as if by calling glCreateShader, attached to a Program as if by calling glAttachShader and destroyed as if by calling glDeleteShader.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat
member.summary: The WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat interface represents the information returned from the getShaderPrecisionFormat call.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.RangeMin
member.summary: The base 2 log of the absolute value of the minimum value that can be represented.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.RangeMax
member.summary: The base 2 log of the absolute value of the maximum value that can be represented.

member.name: P:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.Precision
member.summary: The number of bits of precision that can be represented. For integer formats this value is always 0.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLTexture
member.summary: The WebGLTexture interface represents an OpenGL Texture Object. The underlying object is created as if by calling glGenTextures, bound as if by calling glBindTexture and destroyed as if by calling glDeleteTextures.

member.name: T:System.Html.Media.Graphics.WebGL.WebGLUniformLocation

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.Copy
member.summary: A (B is ignored). Display the source image instead of the destination image.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.DestinationAtop
member.summary: B atop A. Display the destination image wherever both images are opaque. Display the source image wherever the source image is opaque but the destination image is transparent. Display transparency elsewhere.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.DestinationIn
member.summary: B in A. Display the destination image wherever both the destination image and source image are opaque. Display transparency elsewhere.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.DestinationOut
member.summary: B out A. Display the destination image wherever the destination image is opaque and the source image is transparent. Display transparency elsewhere.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.DestinationOver
member.summary: B over A. Display the destination image wherever the destination image is opaque. Display the source image elsewhere.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.Lighter
member.summary: A plus B. Display the sum of the source image and destination image, with color values approaching 1 as a limit.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.SourceAtop
member.summary: A atop B. Display the source image wherever both images are opaque. Display the destination image wherever the destination image is opaque but the source image is transparent. Display transparency elsewhere.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.SourceIn
member.summary: A in B. Display the source image wherever both the source image and destination image are opaque. Display transparency elsewhere.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.SourceOut
member.summary: A out B. Display the source image wherever the source image is opaque and the destination image is transparent. Display transparency elsewhere.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.SourceOver
member.summary: A over B. Display the source image wherever the source image is opaque. Display the destination image elsewhere. This is the default option.

member.name: F:System.Html.Media.Graphics.CompositeOperation.Xor
member.summary: A xor B. Exclusive OR of the source image and destination image.
